info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 6:40PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington and southeastern Iron Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 640 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Zion National Park, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Zion National Park, Hurricane, La Verkin, Sand Hollow State Park, Quail Creek State Park, Toquerville, Leeds, Virgin and Pintura. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 17 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
